objenome.goal

Class HitsCount

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.solver.evolve.AbstractFitnessFunction<TypedOrganism>
      • objenome.goal.TypedFitnessFunction
        • objenome.goal.HitsCount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener<ConfigEvent>, FitnessFunction<TypedOrganism>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HitsCountAndMinified

    public class HitsCount
extends TypedFitnessFunction
implements Listener<ConfigEvent>, GPContainer.GPContainerAware
    A fitness function for STGPIndividuals that calculates and assigns DoubleFitness.Minimise scores. The fitness scores are calculated by executing the program for each of the provided sets of inputs. The results are compared to the expected outputs and a count of the number of correct results is given as the fitness value. Can work with doubles or other object types. If doubles are used then the point error option is used, otherwise the objects are just compared for equality. When using this fitness function the TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VARIABLES, TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VALUE_SETS and EXPECTED_OUTPUTS config options must be set, or the same values set using the mutator methods provided. The length of the INPUT_VALUE_SETS array should match the length of the EXPECTED_OUTPUTS array and the number of values in each set should match the length of the INPUT_VARIABLES array.
    Since:
    2.0

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(GPContainer config)
        Sets up this operator with the appropriate configuration settings. This method is called whenever a ConfigEvent occurs for a change in any of the following configuration parameters:
        • TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VARIABLES
        • TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VALUE_SETS
        • EXPECTED_OUTPUTS
        • POINT_ERROR
        Specified by:
        setConfig in interface GPContainer.GPContainerAware

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent(ConfigEvent event)
        Receives configuration events and triggers this fitness function to configure its parameters if the ConfigEvent is for one of its required parameters.
        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface Listener<ConfigEvent>
        Parameters:
        event - the fired event object.

      • evaluate

        public DoubleFitness.Minimize evaluate(Population population,
                                       TypedOrganism individual)
        Calculates the fitness of the given individual. This fitness function only operates on STGPIndividuals. The fitness returned will be an instance of DoubleFitness.Minimise. The fitness score is a count of the number of sets of inputs that produce a correct result (or 'hit'). For double types a hit can have an error range, specified by the POINT_ERROR config key.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class AbstractFitnessFunction<TypedOrganism>
        Parameters:
        individual - the program to evaluate
        Returns:
        the fitness of the given individual
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the individual is not an STGPIndividual

        public double getCost(TypedOrganism program)

      • isHit

        protected boolean isHit(java.lang.Object result,
                        java.lang.Object expectedResult)
        Decides whether a value returned by a program is considered to be a hit or not, when compared to the expected result.
        Parameters:
        result - the result returned by the program
        expectedResult - the correct result
        Returns:
        true if the result is considered to be a hit and false otherwise

      • getPointError

        public double getPointError()
        Returns the point error which defines the range allowable for double values to be considered a hit.
        Returns:
        the point error for a double value to be considered a hit

      • setPointError

        public void setPointError(double pointError)
        Sets the point error which defines the range allowable for double values to be considered a hit. This is unused for non-Double fitness values. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the POINT_ERROR configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        pointError - the point error for a double value to be considered a hit

      • getInputVariables

        public Variable[] getInputVariables()
        Gets the input variables that are currently set
        Returns:
        the current input variables

      • setInputVariables

        public void setInputVariables(Variable[] inputVariables)
        Sets the input variables. These should be the variables used in the terminal set, which will have the input values assigned to them. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VARIABLES configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        inputVariables - the input variables

      • getInputValueSets

        public java.lang.Object[][] getInputValueSets()
        Returns the sets of input values.
        Returns:
        the sets of input values

      • setInputValueSets

        public void setInputValueSets(java.lang.Object[][] inputValueSets)
        Sets the sets of input values. The length of the array should match the length of the expected outputs array. Each set of values should have the same number of values, equal to the length of the input variables array. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the TypedFitnessFunction.INPUT_VALUE_SETS configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        inputValueSets - the sets of input values

      • getExpectedOutputs

        public java.lang.Object[] getExpectedOutputs()
        Returns the expected outputs that the actual outputs will be compared against
        Returns:
        the expected outputs for the input sets

      • setExpectedOutputs

        public void setExpectedOutputs(java.lang.Object[] expectedOutputs)
        Sets the expected outputs to compare against. The length of the array should match the length of the input values array. If automatic configuration is enabled then any value set here will be overwritten by the EXPECTED_OUTPUTS configuration setting on the next config event.
        Parameters:
        expectedOutputs - the expected outputs to compare against
